conclusion: Consider principles of refraction when light passes from air into water.
When light travels from a less dense medium (air) to a denser medium (water), it bends towards the normal.
The incident ray travels from point A towards the boundary.
Upon entering the water, the light bends towards the normal and passes through point B.
Point O1 is where the incident ray meets the boundary between air and water.
Point O is the intersection of the straight line AB with the boundary.
The refracted ray towards B is closer to the normal than the incident ray, indicating O1 is to the right of O.
Conclusion: Point O1 is to the right of point O.
Final Answer: Yes, point O1 is to the right of point O.
